metadata.description:
This dataset contains the data of the meteorological element gradient observation system of the Sidaoqiao superstation downstream of the Heihe Hydrometeorological Observation Network from January 1, 2014 to December 31, 2014. The site is located in Sidaoqiao, Dalaihu Town, Ejin Banner, Inner Mongolia. The underlying surface is Tamarix. The latitude and longitude of the observation point is 101.1374E, 42.0012N, and the altitude is 873m. The air temperature, relative humidity and wind speed sensors are respectively set at 5m, 7m, 10m, 15m, 20m and 28m, with 6 layers facing the north; the wind direction sensor is set at 15m, facing the north; the barometer is installed in the waterproof box. The tipping bucket rain gauge is installed at 28m; the four-component radiometer is installed at 10m, facing south; two infrared thermometers are installed at 10m, facing south, the probe orientation is vertically downward; two photosynthetically active radiometers are installed At 10m, facing south, and the probe is vertically upward and downward respectively; the soil moisture sensor is installed 2m on the south side of the tower body, and the soil heat flow plates (self-correcting type) (3 pieces) are buried in turn in the ground 6cm deep; The average soil temperature sensor TCAV is buried in the ground 2cm, 4cm; the soil temperature probe is buried in the ground surface 0cm and underground 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm; soil moisture sensors are buried in the underground 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm.
Observed items include: wind speed (WS_5m, WS_7m, WS_10m, WS_15m, WS_20m, WS_28m) (unit: m/s), wind direction (WD_15m) (unit: degree), air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m, Ta_7m, Ta_10m, Ta_15m, Ta_20m, Ta_28m and RH_5m, RH_7m, RH_10m, RH_15m, RH_20m, RH_28m) (unit: centigrade, percentage), pressure (unit: hectopascal), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), four-component radiation (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts/square meter), surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit: centigrade), up and down photosynthetically active radiation (PAR_U_up, PAR_U_down) (unit: micromol/square Msec), average soil temperature (TCAV) (unit: centigrade), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: watts/square meter), soil moisture (Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_80cm) , Ms_120cm, Ms_160cm) (unit: volumetric water content, percentage), soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_2cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_80cm, Ts_120cm, Ts_160cm) (unit: centigrade).
Processing and quality control of the observation data: (1) ensure 144 data per day (every 10 minutes), when there is missing data, it is marked by -6999; From September 8, 2014 to November 8, due to the sensor problems, the data is missing; on May 9, 2014, the soil moisture probe was re-buried, and the data before and after is inconsistent; (2) eliminate the moment with duplicate records; (3) delete the data that is obviously beyond the physical meaning or the range of the instrument; (5) the format of date and time is uniform, and the date and time are in the same column. For example, the time is: 2014-9-10 10:30; (6) the naming rules are: AWS+ site name.
For hydrometeorological network or site information, please refer to Li et al. (2013). For observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).

观测项目有：风速（WS_5m、WS_7m、WS_10m、WS_15m、WS_20m、WS_28m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_15m）(单位：度)、空气温湿度（Ta_5m、Ta_7m、Ta_10m、Ta_15m、Ta_20m、Ta_28m和RH_5m、RH_7m、RH_10m、RH_15m、RH_20m、RH_28m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、向上和向下光合有效辐射（PAR_U_up、PAR_U_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)、平均土壤温度（TCAV）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；土壤热通量G2在2014.9.18-11.8之间由于传感器的问题，数据缺失；在2014年5月9日重新埋设土壤水分探头，前后数据不连贯；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2014-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al.(2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的测量值就可以进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层），并与使用波文比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果进行了比较。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观察到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观测比率。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散发（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计算为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的入射短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用10 Hz采样频率的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热成像相机获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热成像图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于蒸散发的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值很好地一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其在发展中国家尤为明显（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，该地区自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域被先前的研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，涵盖了2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度、风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时还记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionCn: 在处理水文气象数据集时使用的数据质量控制技术的一个例子是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a data quality control technique is the process of ensuring data completeness by marking missing data with specific codes (e.g., -6999 for missing values), removing duplicate records, and eliminating data points that appear to exceed physical or instrumental limits, as well as flagging questionable data using color codes for further review.
Example.AnswerCn: 数据质量控制技术的一个例子是通过使用特定代码（例如，-6999表示缺失值）标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，消除超出物理或仪器限制的数据点，以及使用颜色编码标记可疑数据以便进一步审查。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the data collection methods used for observing meteorological parameters in arid and semiarid regions?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区观察气象参数的数据收集方法有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: automatic weather stations, air temperature, wind speed, humidity, radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, gradients of air temperature and humidity, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, soil moisture profiles, eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, turbulent fluxes

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'eddy covariance system' mean in the context of hydrometeorological data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在水文气象数据收集的背景下，“涡度协方差系统”指的是一种用于测量和分析气体（如二氧化碳和水蒸气）在大气与地表之间交换的技术。
Definition.AnswerEn: An 'eddy covariance system' refers to a measurement technique used to quantify turbulent fluxes of energy, water vapor, carbon, and other gases between the land surface and the atmosphere. This system typically involves the use of high-frequency sensors to capture vertical wind speeds and scalar concentrations, allowing for the calculation of fluxes based on the covariance between these variables. In the context of hydrometeorological data collection, it provides half-hourly turbulent flux data as part of a comprehensive suite of observational datasets.
Definition.AnswerCn: “涡度协方差系统”是指一种测量技术，用于量化能量、水蒸气、碳和其他气体在地表与大气之间的湍流通量。该系统通常使用高频传感器捕捉垂直风速和标量浓度，从而基于这些变量之间的协方差计算通量。在水文气象数据收集的背景下，它提供半小时的湍流通量数据，作为一套综合观测数据集的一部分。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in the challenges faced in data collection for energy balance models in arid agricultural areas versus oasis-desert ecosystems?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在干旱农业地区与绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，能量平衡模型的数据收集面临的挑战有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In arid agricultural areas, challenges include accurately estimating surface fluxes due to strong advective environments and incomplete energy balance closure in EC flux measurements. In contrast, oasis-desert ecosystems face challenges such as ecological degradation and maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems, which require long-term data collection for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges. Both environments require advanced methodologies to address these specific challenges.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在干旱农业地区，由于强烈的平流环境和涡度协方差（EC）通量测量中的能量平衡闭合不完全，准确估计表面通量面临挑战。相比之下，绿洲-沙漠生态系统面临的挑战包括生态退化以及维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡，这需要长期的数据收集以理解能量、水蒸气和碳的交换。这两种环境都需要先进的方法来应对这些特定的挑战。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways can integrating remote sensing data with ground-based observations enhance the understanding of evapotranspiration processes in arid and semi-arid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 将遥感数据与地面观测相结合，可以在以下几个方面增强对干旱和半干旱地区蒸散发过程的理解：
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Integrating remote sensing data with ground-based observations provides a more comprehensive view of evapotranspiration processes by combining high-resolution spatial data with detailed temporal measurements. Remote sensing can cover larger areas and offer insights into regional patterns, while ground-based data provide precise local measurements, allowing for validation and calibration of models. This combination is particularly useful in capturing the spatial heterogeneity and temporal dynamics of water and energy exchanges in arid and semi-arid regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 将遥感数据与地面观测相结合，可以通过结合高分辨率的空间数据和详细的时间测量，提供对蒸散发过程的更全面视角。遥感可以覆盖更大区域，并提供区域模式的洞察，而地面数据则提供精确的局部测量，允许模型的验证和校准。这种结合在捕捉干旱和半干旱地区水分和能量交换的空间异质性和时间动态方面特别有用。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors have led to the necessity of complex data collection systems in hydrometeorological observations, particularly in the context of oasis–desert interactions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠相互作用的背景下，导致复杂数据收集系统在水文气象观测中必要性的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The need for complex data collection systems in hydrometeorological observations, especially in oasis–desert interactions, stems from the necessity to understand the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange dynamics. This understanding is crucial for maintaining ecological stability and achieving sustainable development goals in arid and semi-arid regions. The unique ecological landscape of oases, which supports a significant population, necessitates detailed observations to manage water resources and ecological security effectively.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在水文气象观测中，尤其是在绿洲与沙漠的相互作用中，复杂数据收集系统的需求源于理解能量、水汽和碳交换动态的必要性。这种理解对于维持生态稳定和实现干旱及半干旱地区的可持续发展目标至关重要。绿洲独特的生态景观支持着大量人口，因此需要进行详细的观测，以有效管理水资源和生态安全。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it important to account for errors in component temperature estimations when using models for evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在使用模型估算异质景观中的蒸散发时，考虑组件温度估算中的误差是重要的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accounting for errors in component temperature estimations is crucial because inaccuracies can significantly affect the performance of models like the TSEB model, which are used for estimating evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes. Errors primarily arise from image classification inaccuracies and other factors such as atmospheric radiation, which can lead to overestimations of component temperatures, thereby impacting the reliability of evapotranspiration estimates.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 考虑组件温度估计中的误差是至关重要的，因为不准确可能会显著影响像TSEB模型这样的模型的性能，这些模型用于估计异质景观中的蒸散发。误差主要源于图像分类的不准确性以及其他因素，如大气辐射，这可能导致组件温度的过高估计，从而影响蒸散发估计的可靠性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the reasons for the challenges faced in data collection in arid and semi-arid regions, particularly regarding the degradation of natural environments?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，数据收集面临的挑战主要有以下几个原因，特别是与自然环境退化相关的方面：
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Challenges in data collection in arid and semi-arid regions, such as the degradation of natural environments, are influenced by factors like the drying up of rivers, land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These challenges are exacerbated by climate change and human activities, which impact the ecological balance and complicate the collection and accuracy of environmental data necessary for managing these fragile ecosystems.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，数据收集面临的挑战，如自然环境的退化，受到河流干涸、土地沙漠化和频繁沙尘暴等因素的影响。这些挑战因气候变化和人类活动而加剧，影响生态平衡， complicate 了收集和准确获取管理这些脆弱生态系统所需的环境数据。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of using high-resolution thermal cameras in data collection for estimating evapotranspiration in oasis-desert systems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中使用高分辨率热成像相机进行数据收集以估算蒸散发的潜在后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using high-resolution thermal cameras allows for more accurate separation of soil and vegetation component temperatures, which can improve the estimation of evapotranspiration by providing reliable estimates of latent heat fluxes. This results in better validation of evaporation and transpiration ratios, even in strongly advective conditions, as shown by the TSEB model's performance when validated against ground-based measurements.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪可以更准确地分离土壤和植被的温度成分，从而通过提供可靠的潜热通量估计来改善蒸散发的估算。这导致了蒸发和蒸腾比率的更好验证，即使在强烈的平流条件下，TSEB模型在与地面测量结果验证时的表现也得到了体现。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the use of eddy covariance systems and scintillometers in data collection impact the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis-desert areas?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪在数据收集中的使用如何影响对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水蒸气和碳交换的理解？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The use of eddy covariance systems and scintillometers provides high-frequency, half-hourly data on turbulent fluxes, enhancing the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges. These instruments help in capturing the dynamics of these exchanges, supporting the goal of achieving sustainable oasis development by providing critical insights into the interactions within oasis-desert ecosystems.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪的使用提供了高频率、半小时的数据，关于湍流通量，增强了对能量、水蒸气和碳交换的理解。这些仪器有助于捕捉这些交换的动态，支持实现可持续绿洲发展的目标，通过提供对绿洲-沙漠生态系统内部相互作用的关键见解。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the implications of long-term observational datasets from oasis-desert systems for carbon peaking and carbon neutrality goals?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据集对绿洲-沙漠系统的碳达峰和碳中和目标的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets provide a quantitative understanding of the interactions between energy, water vapor, and carbon in oasis-desert systems, which is crucial for achieving carbon peaking and carbon neutrality. These datasets offer insights into the ecological and socioeconomic impacts, aiding in the development of strategies to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems and support sustainable development goals.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据集提供了对绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水蒸气和碳之间相互作用的定量理解，这对于实现碳达峰和碳中和至关重要。这些数据集提供了对生态和社会经济影响的洞察，有助于制定维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间平衡的策略，并支持可持续发展目标。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the ultimate aim of establishing a hydrometeorological observation network in a specific ecological region?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在特定生态区域建立水文气象观测网络的最终目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal of establishing a hydrometeorological observation network is to collect comprehensive data on meteorological and soil parameters to understand the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange processes in oasis-desert ecosystems. This understanding is crucial for achieving sustainable development and maintaining ecological balance in arid and semi-arid regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 建立水文气象观测网络的目标是收集关于气象和土壤参数的综合数据，以了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换过程。这种理解对于实现可持续发展和维持干旱及半干旱地区的生态平衡至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are employed to ensure the quality control of meteorological and hydrological data collected from a superstation in arid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 为了确保在干旱地区收集的超级气象站的气象和水文数据的质量控制，采用了哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The quality control procedures include ensuring daily data integrity with 144 data points every 10 minutes, marking missing data with a specific placeholder, and removing duplicates. Data that fall outside physical or instrument limits are deleted, and questionable data are highlighted for review. Consistent formatting for date and time is also maintained.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 质量控制程序包括确保每日数据完整性，每10分钟收集144个数据点，用特定占位符标记缺失数据，并删除重复数据。超出物理或仪器限制的数据将被删除，值得怀疑的数据将被标记以供审核。同时，日期和时间的格式保持一致。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are soil and canopy component temperatures derived and validated for evaluating energy balance models in agricultural settings?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 土壤和冠层组件温度是如何推导和验证的，以评估农业环境中的能量平衡模型？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Soil and canopy component temperatures are derived using a thermal infrared camera, with images classified into soil and canopy pixels. The directional brightness temperatures are extracted and converted to radiation temperatures using long-wave radiation observations and emissivities. These temperatures are validated against surface radiometric temperatures calculated from four-component radiometer observations.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 土壤和冠层组件温度是通过热红外相机获得的，图像被分类为土壤和冠层像素。提取方向亮度温度并使用长波辐射观测和发射率转换为辐射温度。这些温度与通过四分量辐射计观测计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the steps involved in setting up and collecting data from an eddy covariance system to measure energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis–desert systems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn:
设置和收集来自涡度协方差系统的数据，以测量绿洲-沙漠系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳通量的步骤包括：

1. 选择合适的地点：选择一个代表性的绿洲-沙漠交界区域，确保该地点能够反映研究目标。

2. 安装涡度协方差系统：根据制造商的说明，安装涡度协方差设备，包括风速传感器、气体分析仪和数据记录器。

3. 校准仪器：在安装前对所有传感器进行校准，以确保测量的准确性。

4. 连接数据记录器：将所有传感器连接到数据记录器，确保数据能够实时记录。

5. 设置数据采集频率：根据研究需求设置数据采集的频率，通常为10 Hz或更高。

6. 进行初步测试：在正式收集数据之前，进行初步测试以确保系统正常运行。

7. 收集数据：开始正式的数据收集，持续监测系统的运行状态。

8. 数据处理：定期下载和处理数据，进行质量控制，剔除异常值。

9. 数据分析：分析收集的数据，以计算能量、水蒸气和碳通量。

10. 结果验证：与其他测量方法或模型结果进行比较，以验证数据的可靠性。

11. 定期维护：定期检查和维护设备，确保长期稳定运行。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The setup includes installing an eddy covariance system and scintillometer for half-hourly turbulent flux data collection. Automatic weather stations measure various hydrometeorological parameters with a 10-minute average period. Vegetation and soil parameters are also recorded. Data processing involves collection, quality control, and archiving and sharing for further analysis.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 该系统的设置包括安装涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪，以收集半小时的湍流通量数据。自动气象站测量各种水文气象参数，平均周期为10分钟。同时也记录植被和土壤参数。数据处理包括数据收集、质量控制、归档和共享，以便进一步分析。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the precise measurement of soil and canopy component temperatures in arid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在干旱地区能够精确测量土壤和冠层组件的温度？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of high-resolution thermal cameras, such as the Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera, enables the precise measurement of soil and canopy component temperatures. These cameras are used to capture thermal radiation images, which are then processed to obtain radiometric temperatures for soil and canopy components.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 高分辨率热像仪的使用，例如Fluke Ti55热红外相机，使得土壤和冠层组件温度的精确测量成为可能。这些相机用于捕捉热辐射图像，然后对其进行处理以获得土壤和冠层组件的辐射温度。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions or methodologies enable the effective separation of soil and vegetation component temperatures in the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些条件或方法能够有效分离两源能量平衡（TSEB）模型中的土壤和植被组分温度？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The effective separation of soil and vegetation component temperatures in the TSEB model is enabled by using thermal images to classify soil and canopy pixels and calculate directional brightness temperatures. The methodology involves converting thermal infrared temperatures to radiation temperatures using long-wave radiation data and emissivities, which allows for accurate temperature separation and subsequent energy balance calculations.
Enablement.AnswerCn: TSEB模型中有效分离土壤和植被组分温度的能力是通过使用热成像来分类土壤和冠层像素，并计算方向亮度温度实现的。该方法涉及将热红外温度转换为辐射温度，使用长波辐射数据和发射率，这样可以实现准确的温度分离和后续的能量平衡计算。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expected challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas, and why might traditional data collection methods struggle to address these?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量面临的预期挑战是什么？传统数据收集方法为何可能难以解决这些问题？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas is challenging due to the incomplete energy balance closure when using EC flux measurements of H and LE. Traditional data collection methods might struggle because the uncertainty in surface-air temperature difference can dominate, and errors in determining surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from composite radiometric temperatures can affect the model's performance.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一个挑战，因为使用涡度协方差（EC）测量的感热（H）和潜热（LE）时能量平衡闭合不完全。传统的数据收集方法可能会遇到困难，因为表面与空气温度差的不确定性可能占主导地位，而从复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差可能会影响模型的性能。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be an expectation that certain parameters and observations required for evapotranspiration models cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么会有一种期望，认为某些用于蒸散发模型的参数和观测值无法从操作卫星和地面数据中轻易获得？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Certain parameters and observations required for evapotranspiration models may not be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data because the models, such as the Shuttleworth and Wallace two-source evapotranspiration model, are complex and involve multiple resistances that are difficult to calculate. Additionally, the necessary input data for these models is often not available from conventional observation systems.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 某些用于蒸散发模型的参数和观测值可能无法从操作卫星和地面数据中轻易获得，因为模型（如Shuttleworth和Wallace双源蒸散发模型）复杂，涉及多个难以计算的阻力。此外，这些模型所需的输入数据通常无法从传统观测系统中获得。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What expectations exist regarding the effectiveness of composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions, and what factors contribute to these expectations?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，对于复合温度分离方法的有效性存在哪些期望，这些期望受哪些因素的影响？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The effectiveness of composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions is expected to be limited. This limitation arises because errors in the derived component temperature are primarily caused by image classification errors, which vary with vegetation abundance. Additionally, uncertainties in atmospheric upwelling radiation, transmittance, and estimated incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy contribute to these expectations.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，复合温度分离方法的有效性预计会受到限制。这种限制的原因在于，衍生的组成温度中的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，而这些错误会随着植被丰度的变化而变化。此外，大气上行辐射、透射率以及通过树冠估算的入射短波和长波辐射的透射率的不确定性也加剧了这些预期。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do researchers evaluate the effectiveness of data collection methods for capturing accurate soil and canopy temperatures in heterogeneous landscapes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 研究人员如何评估数据收集方法在异质景观中捕捉准确土壤和树冠温度的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Researchers utilize ground-based measurement data, such as those obtained from high-resolution thermal cameras, to accurately assess soil and canopy temperatures. These temperatures are crucial for partitioning evapotranspiration into its components, and the effectiveness is evaluated by comparing the derived temperatures against observed values, ensuring they align with the energy balance equations used in the TSEB model.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 研究人员利用地面测量数据，例如高分辨率热像仪获得的数据，准确评估土壤和冠层温度。这些温度对于将蒸散发分解为其组成部分至关重要，评估其有效性的方法是将得出的温度与观测值进行比较，确保它们与在TSEB模型中使用的能量平衡方程相一致。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What challenges do researchers face when ensuring the quality and continuity of hydrometeorological data in arid regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 研究人员在确保干旱地区水文气象数据的质量和连续性时面临哪些挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Challenges include dealing with data loss due to sensor issues, such as missing soil heat flux data, and ensuring that data is not duplicated or contains values beyond physical or instrumental limits. Quality control involves flagging questionable data, standardizing formats, and addressing gaps, such as those caused by reinstallation or malfunctioning of sensors, to maintain a continuous and reliable dataset.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 挑战包括处理由于传感器问题导致的数据丢失，例如缺失的土壤热通量数据，以及确保数据不重复或包含超出物理或仪器限制的值。质量控制涉及标记可疑数据、标准化格式以及解决由于重新安装或传感器故障造成的缺口，以维护连续和可靠的数据集。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the data collection methods used in hydrometeorological observations within the oasis–desert systems from 2012 to 2021, highlighting the type of equipment and frequency of data collection.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨2012年至2021年间在绿洲-沙漠系统中使用的水文气象观测的数据收集方法，重点介绍设备类型和数据收集的频率。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The hydrometeorological data in oasis–desert systems were collected using automatic weather stations and included measurements of radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, gradients of air temperature and humidity, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles. These observations were recorded with a 10-minute average period, and additional data were acquired using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，水文气象数据通过自动气象站收集，包括辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面的测量。这些观测数据以10分钟的平均周期记录，此外还使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取了额外的数据。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges faced in accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas using the TSEB model.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析在强对流灌溉农业区域中使用TSEB模型准确估计表面通量所面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas is challenging due to the incomplete energy balance closure in EC flux measurements and errors in determining surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from composite radiometric temperatures. The strong advective environment and image classification errors also contribute to the uncertainty in model performance, affecting the separation of soil and vegetation component temperatures.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是具有挑战性的，这主要是由于涡动相关（EC）通量测量中的能量平衡闭合不完全，以及从复合辐射温度中确定表层土壤和植被组分温度的错误。强烈的平流环境和图像分类错误也增加了模型性能的不确定性，影响了土壤和植被组分温度的分离。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please investigate the potential sources and strategies for expanding datasets related to energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请调查与绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换相关的数据集扩展的潜在来源和策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: To expand datasets on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems, researchers could enhance long-term observational datasets by integrating data from additional land surface flux and meteorological stations. These datasets could include detailed hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameters, and involve data collection from both artificial and natural oasis–desert systems, as seen in the middle and lower reaches of the Heihe River Basin.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 为了扩展绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的数据集，研究人员可以通过整合来自额外的地表通量和气象站的数据来增强长期观测数据集。这些数据集可以包括详细的水文气象、植被和土壤参数，并涉及来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的数据收集，如在黑河流域的中下游地区所见。
